original_title: A Proper OS For The Sega Genesis/Megadrive
original_content:
The console wars of the early 1990s had several players, but the battle that mattered was between Nintendos SNES and Segas Genesis, or Megadrive if you are European. They are both famous for their games, but in terms of software they can only run whats on a cartridge. The Genesis has a Motorola 68000 on board though, which is capable of far more than just Sonic the Hedgehog. [EythorE] evidently thinks so, because heres a port of Fusix, a UNIX-like OS, for the Sega platform.
As it stands, the OS is running on the BlastEm emulator, but given a Sega Saturn keyboard or a modified PC keyboard for the Sega, it could be run on real hardware. What you get is a basic UNIX-like OS with a working shell and the usual UNIX utilities. With 64k of memory to play with this will never be a powerhouse, but on the other hand wed be curious to see it in a working cartridge.
Meanwhile, if the console interests you further, someone has been into its workings in great detail.
